title: 108_hr3495
content: Section 629 of the Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act is amended to establish an Emergency Preparedness Demonstration Program to assist disadvantaged communities. The Director will establish an emergency preparedness demonstration program to help disadvantaged communities improve their capacity for emergency response. Grants will be provided to eligible nonprofit organizations to conduct research on emergency preparedness in households of disadvantaged individuals and promote awareness of emergency situations. The program aims to assist disadvantaged communities in urban and rural areas affected by disasters by promoting emergency preparedness education through nonprofit organizations. Eligible organizations must be nonprofit and tax-exempt under section 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code. Nonprofit organizations eligible for grants must be tax-exempt under section 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code and have a primary mission to serve disadvantaged communities. They must also demonstrate a partnership with a disadvantaged business enterprise. Funds from the grant can only be used for professional services for research in disadvantaged communities and developing informational materials. The grant allows nonprofit organizations to acquire expert services for research in disadvantaged communities, develop informational materials for emergency preparedness awareness, collaborate with national organizations and institutions to disseminate information, and implement projects with institutions serving disadvantaged individuals. The grant allows nonprofit organizations to collaborate with institutions serving disadvantaged individuals, including part B institutions, institutions described in section 326(e)(1) of the Higher Education Act of 1965, and Hispanic-serving institutions. To be eligible for funding, organizations must submit an application to the Director following the specified procedure. The Director requires organizations to submit an application with necessary information. Definitions for disadvantaged business enterprise, community, and individual are provided. HUBZone is also defined. The Small Business Act defines 'individual' as a socially or economically disadvantaged individual and 'HUBZone' as specified in the Act. Authorization of appropriation is provided for fiscal years 2004 through 2007.
